Key Match Events: Kai Havertz scored for Germany in the 56th minute.
Pascal Gross scored the winning goal for Germany in the 89th minute.
Giorgos Masouras scored for Greece in the 33rd minute.
Dimitris Giannoulis received a yellow card in the 80th minute.
Pre-Game Insights: Germany welcome Greece to Borussia-Park for their final warm-up fixture before hosting Euro 2024.
This is the first meeting between Germany and Greece in 12 years, with their last encounter being a 4-2 victory for Germany in the Euro 2012 quarter-finals.
Julian Nagelsmann has had a mixed start as Germany's head coach, with three wins, two draws, and two losses in his first seven games.
Germany's recent form includes impressive victories over France and the Netherlands, and a goalless draw with Ukraine.
Greece were eliminated from Euro 2024 qualifying after a penalty-shootout defeat to Georgia.
Nikolaos Papadopoulos is serving as Greece's interim coach after Gus Poyet left his position.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Germany has beaten Greece in six of their previous nine meetings, scoring at least twice on all six occasions.
Greece has never beaten Germany in their previous nine encounters, with three draws and six losses.
